channel.title: A little chat related help needed[PI]
channel.description:
So, as a player of recent rsps's (got bored) I realized one thing that irritated me the most was that both yell and game messages (Like "your current slayer task is X" or what ever).
Base: PI Revision: 317
Issue: I want to know how to send different chat packets.
Explanation: How do I pick what chat a message would be sent though. Like do I use sendFrame X for a trade/p chat/clan/public message? What's the difference between the packets? And how could I possibly make a method to send a message through each (like c.sendMessage, but for the other chat types.)

item.title: A little chat related help needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

sendMessage (253_outgoing) would be used for game messages, essentially. this includes trade and duel requests (just parse the string to include :duelreq:, :tradereq: etc

public (4_incoming) would be used for all public chat, talking etc.

private (196_outgoing, 126_incoming) would be used for private messages etc.

if you’re looking to add the features to filter chat like rs does, you should go and redo the way it is handled in most base clients (best bet starting fresh with a deob)

also look into packet 95 for changing the privacy ( on/off/hide,filter, etc)

Read full topic
item.source: A little chat related help needed[PI]

item.title: A little chat related help needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Vain_:

they’re all different packets. chat, private message, game, trade, duel, etc.

Well yeah, but you can call sendMessage virtually anywhere.

Read full topic

There’s Trade Chat
Game Chat

and Private Chat.

item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

Oh, do you mean making a method what is ( example ) sending global messages through the clan chat/ all other chats like ‘trade’ etc.? Or do you mean when a message gets sent from the normal chatbox it should show up in all chat categories?
